name: Villa Floresta

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We lost two hours of the time we had available to explore Taormina because of inexplicable difficulty in merely checking into this hotel. After finally locating the hotel and finding a temporary place to park while we unloaded our luggage, we were shocked to find no one there to check us in or even store our luggage. No message or note was on the door to explain the situation. Thinking that the hotel might not even be open for business, we reloaded our luggage and parked in the Catania parking garage and began walking the streets in search of a place to stay. Two hours later, we returned to find someone at the hotel, requiring us to walk back to the parking garage and carry our bags all the way back to the hotel. Astonishingly, we received no apology or even an explanation for the situation; we were merely shown our room, given the keys and asked to immediately pay cash in advance for the room.
reviews.title: Valuable time wasted

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel could be a reasonable value for someone who places little or no value on their own time.
reviews.title: Great place, great fun!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent three nights in this lovable B&B. Although Taormina is a difficult place for parking, we got a close parking slot. Caretakers were always nice to us and breakfast, in the beautiful coffee place next to the B&B, was simply delicious. It was nice to wake up in the morning in our nice room with the sun coming through our window. Furthermore, the B&B is in the very centre at walking distance from the Greek thetre and the night clubs.
reviews.title: Exceptoinal Views - Basic Service

reviews.text: We stayed Jan 08 at this B&B. it really should be called a Pensione as no breakfast was included or offered. The breakfast that they advertise is coffe and a brioche at the snack bar (Billy & Billy) jn the building next door. They will charge you 3 Euro for the coupon. You can get better all over town.
reviews.title: Handy location, OK accomodation

reviews.text: A wonderful place!!! Near to pubs and shops, Villa Floresta is situated inside the hystoric centre of Taormina close to the most important monuments!!!! I was stayed in March at this little B&B at the room nr. 2 equipped with balconies with wiew on the sea and on the cathedral. My room was very nice and clean!!! Maria & Angelo were been very preatty with us!! Many thanks for all.
reviews.title: A lovely B&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Condition of this place is reflected in the price despite the good internet photo's, good location but building needs a very good renovation done. Hard to get a hold of owners as they were never on site. Would not stay here again but for those not fussed about smelly bathrooms and run down rooms it is in an ideal location.
reviews.title: Not what we wanted

reviews.text: I would very much like to recommend your charming B&B, beautifully situated in the heart of Taormina. The idyllic setting of Villa Floresta is perfect to explore all this unique city has to offer in day as well as night life. We very much enjoyed breakfast directly at the Piazza Duomo, and once again here the staff at the cafe was very friendly.
reviews.title: Excellent price/quality with charm

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The authentic flair of the house and the charm of your family have made the experience of our visit unique and we are very happy to recommend you and your city given the opportunity.
reviews.title: Could be much better
Villa Floresta
reviews.text: On behalf of the three of us, I would like to thank once again Ernesto, Maria & Angelo for your kind hospitality and the tips provided which have enabled us to enjoy our stay in Taormina so much.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Recently I visited Villa Floresta for the second time, I also stayed there in 2010. It was just as I remembered, this time I had a different room, this one did not have a view but was still fine. This is a simple, clean and comfortable b&b in a fantastic location. It is great value for money. To find fault with this place one must have unrealistic expectations.
reviews.title: Just as I remembered it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a room with a beautiful view on the sea and the streets of Taormina. The view on the roof terrace, where breakfast was served, included a view on mount Etna, the Greek theater and most of the town. Breakfast was being served by the charming landlady herself. The hotel is strategically positioned among good restaurants, close to the main street and close to one of the parking garages. The building is romantic and our room comfortable.
reviews.title: Room with a marvelous view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were booked for one night over Easter and had an email confirmation but on arrival there was no-one at the property and we couldn't raise anyone on either one of the phone numbers or by email. We waited for nearly an hour but eventually gave up and stayed in another hotel. We can only assume the owners were away for the Easter weekend!!! Very disappointing.
reviews.title: Owners missing - we didn't even get in!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I spent two nights (Friday and Saturday nights) at the Villa Floresta, which was presented as a bed and breakfast the Rough Guide to Sicily that we used as our guidebook while visiting Sicily. The situation wasn't what we expected in that the owners do not live at the residence and do not provide the breakfast that was supposed to be included in the price. Instead of breakfast at the B&B, we were given a chit for breakfast at the bar below the hotel. This may have been OK if the bar had opened at a reasonable hour (it opened at 9:30 am) and had been open on Sunday. Because we had plans to see and hike on Mt. Etna on Saturday, we didn't want to wait until the bar opened. On Sunday, the bar was closed and we were provided no breakfast at all. Instead, the owner refunded 2,50 euros per person for the breakfast we weren't provided.
reviews.title: Owners missing in action

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have a problem with a hotel calling itself a B&B or promising that breakfast is included in the price and then not providing breakfast or arranging it so late in the morning that it is of no use to someone who has a limited amount of time to sightsee.
reviews.title: Perfect location

description: The bed and breakfast Villa Floresta is situated in the historical zone of Taormina in central position (on the Corso Umberto, ahead to the cathedral Duomo). It rises in a building going back to the nineteenth century (the ancient house “Casa La Floresta”), which has an entrance with stairs (XV century) protected by the Supervising of the Italian Office of Culture. The building has been completely restructured inside, maintaining the original structure unchanged.All rooms are in modern and functional style and are equipped with bathroom, tv color, Mini Bar, individually controlled heating/air conditioning, orthopedic beds.
